verses.text: （大衛的詩。）地和地上所充滿的，世界和住在世上的，都是屬於耶和華的。（本節在《馬索拉抄本》包括細字標題）

words.definition: on the earth, on the ground

words.note: Often indicates 'that which is...' or 'what is...'
Refers to the Hebrew text of the Old Testament maintained by the Masoretes.

verses.text: 因為他把地奠定在海上，使世界安定在眾水之上。

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb.

verses.text: 誰能登上耶和華的山？誰能站在他的聖所中呢？
就是手潔心清的人，他不傾向虛妄，起誓不懷詭詐。
他必領受從耶和華來的福分，也必蒙拯救他的 神稱他為義。

words.note: Often used in passive sense for receiving grace or favor.

verses.text: 這就是求問耶和華的那一類人，就是尋求你面的雅各。（細拉）

words.note: Commonly used in biblical contexts for seeking God's will.
A Hebrew word of uncertain meaning, often understood as a musical or liturgical instruction.

verses.text: 眾城門哪！抬起你們的頭來；古老的門戶啊！你們要被舉起，好讓榮耀的王進來。

words.note: A key concept in Christian theology.

verses.text: 那榮耀的王是誰呢？就是強而有力的耶和華，在戰場上大有能力的耶和華。

words.note: A key concept in Christian theology.

verses.text: 眾城門哪！抬起你們的頭來；古老的門戶啊！你們要被舉起，好讓榮耀的王進來。

words.note: A key concept in Christian theology.

verses.text: 那榮耀的王是誰呢？萬軍之耶和華，他就是那榮耀的王。（細拉）

words.note: A key concept in Christian theology.
A divine title emphasizing God's sovereignty over all creation.
A key concept in Christian theology.
A Hebrew word of uncertain meaning, often understood as a musical or liturgical instruction.
